main event: On 4 July 1949 at 9:00 P.M. in La Porte, Pennsylvania, 7 objects were observed descending at low altitude with evidence of a minor explosion. The recovered object was made of thin sheet iron or metal, doughnut-shaped, and weighing 20 lbs, painted in a dull black.
interesting points: The observation took place at 9:00 P.M. EST on 4 July 1949 in La Porte, Pennsylvania.
7 objects were observed descending at low altitude with evidence of a minor explosion and light.
The recovered object was made of thin sheet iron or metal, doughnut-shaped, and weighed 20 lbs, painted in a dull black.
The conclusion marked 'Other (Hoax)' suggests that the sighting was deemed a hoax, while 'Was Balloon' under 'CONCLUSIONS' may indicate that the object was identified as a balloon.
The report indicates a Ground-Visual type of observation with no photographs present.
sighted object: 7 objects descending with evidence of a minor explosion
